page.title: 10Bondleigh Ecology Plants
page.content: {Woodlands}are mixed oak, ash and some scrub.Woodland features are{lichens } and{ferns}found growing on trees. Rich lichens flora are (in general) indicators of clean air. These largely undisturbed woodlands form an area of {conservation}for rare plants and bird life (see Bondleigh Ecology Birds). Concern was felt by conservationist when Bondleigh Moor, Common Land (partly in 02/5 64/68) was drained, ploughed and cultivated recently and {rare butterfly orchids}among many othe specis{destroyed.}Some hedge removal has occured.{Footpaths}through lack of use, obliterated. Bridleway No 18 past Ashridge Court is frequently used.{High banks}with primroses, wild rose, bluebell, foxglove, honeysuckle. Hedge cutting by machine is, on these lanes postponed until after flowers have dropped seeds.
